chapter1.title: 01. Skyscraper
chapter1.description: 'Heard about the guy who fell off a skyscraper? On his way down past each floor, he kept saying to reassure himself - so far, so good. How you fall doesn't matter, it's how you land.'

chapter1.title: 02. Abdel
chapter1.description: Abdel Ichaha, has been brutalized by the police shortly before the riot and lies in a coma.

chapter1.title: 03. Saïd
chapter1.description: Saïd is an Arab Maghrebi who inhabits the middle ground between his two friends' responses to their place in life.

chapter1.title: 05. Vinz
chapter1.description: The introduction of Vinz, the Jewish frontman of the movie.

chapter1.title: 06. Contemplation
chapter1.description: The first time we get a glimpse at Vinz, he stares at himself in the mirror and re-enacts the famous scene from Taxi Driver

chapter1.title: 07. Talkin' To Me?
chapter1.description: We get insight into Vinz's inner aggression and rebellious thought process, an important facet of the film.

chapter1.title: 08. Hubert
chapter1.description: Hubert, an African-American, is introduced to us in his burned down boxing arena

chapter1.title: 09. Reason
chapter1.description: Hubert is shown as the voice of reason as Vinz reveals he plans to kill a policeman with a gun he received during the riots.

chapter1.title: 10. Aim
chapter1.description: Vinz remains aggressive in his efforts to seek vengeance for Abdel.

chapter2.title: 11. Arash Ta Mere
chapter2.description: After Vinz nearly shoots a riot policeman and the group narrowly escapes, they take a train to Paris. As we enter the second chapter, we meet with a sign that translates to 'fuck your mother'. This serves to highlight the rebellious nature of the trio as they enter the city of Paris, alluding to the difference in societal class

chapter2.title: 12. Reflections
chapter2.description: One of the best shots from the movie; it shows the difference in mindset of the group. Vinz, careless as ever. Saïd, the middleman. And Hubert, whose back is turned to the camera, presumably in deep thought

chapter2.title: 13. Security
chapter2.description: Saïd and Hubert's alienation from modernity is brought to light here as they try to communicate with the doorman through the CCTV camera.

chapter2.title: 14. Isolation
chapter2.description: While Hubert and Saïd are going about their business, Vinz wanders into a cinema by himself. The bourgeois setting and movie completely contrasts with Vinz's rough background and mindset and here we can see this boredom on his face

chapter2.title: 15. Segregation
chapter2.description: A group of racist skinheads manage to get their hands on Saïd and Hubert and they begin to torture the two of them

chapter2.title: 16. Overheard
chapter2.description: Vinz overhears the skinheads speaking about Saïd and Hubert and realizes he must help them

chapter2.title: 17. Rush of Blood
chapter2.description: When Vinz finds his friends, he uses his pistol to save them and in a rush of blood almost kills one skinhead, however is persuaded to do otherwise by Hubert

chapter2.title: 18. Cautious Relief
chapter2.description: Relieved that they are now safe, Saïd and Hubert also begin to worry about their friend's thirst for revenge.

chapter3.title: 19. Out Of Place
chapter3.description: Forced to remain in Paris because of the train lines closing, the group visits a high-class art gallery where they don't seem to understand or like any of the art of people over there

chapter3.title: 20. Confusion
chapter3.description: The scene begins with Saïd and Vinz staring at a stuffed puppy in utter confusion as they can't understand why that was there. Much like them, the puppy seemed to not belong in the gallery at all.

chapter3.title: 21. OCB
chapter3.description: A beautiful frame wherein we see Vinz's hands as he rolls a joint. In the background, we can see the reflection of the Eiffel Tower on the glass walls of the mall they're in. It goes to show how out of place they are

chapter3.title: 22. The World Is Ours
chapter3.description: While walking in the streets, the trio walks by a poster of the Earth, underneath which is written - the world is ours. Seeing this, Saïd runs back and changes it to - the world is nobody's

chapter3.title: 23. Indecision
chapter3.description: Noting Vinz's agression, the other two speak to each other about his situation as they begin to feel friction between themselves and Vinz

chapter3.title: 24. Daydreaming
chapter3.description: This frame alludes to the insidious aggression in Vinz. As he daydreams about killing a policeman, the window panes on the wall make it seem like he's in a jail cell

chapter3.title: 25. Reality
chapter3.description: After shooting the policeman in his thoughts, he comes back to reality and finds himself staring alone at the TV screens, as his friends are outside, alluding to their different attitudes.

chapter3.title: 26. Gathering
chapter3.description: The three sit in the mall, bored, watching the news on the TV while they try to pass the time till the train lines come back on

chapter3.title: 27. Abdel II
chapter3.description: While watching TV, they come across the news that while in custody, Abdel had succumbed to his injuries. This infuriates the trio, particularly Vinz whose aggressive nature was at its peak.

chapter3.title: 28. Fire
chapter3.description: With his mind filled with hatred and revenge, this frame shows Vinz taking aim, presumably at the policeman in his mind.

chapter4.title: 29. Journey
chapter4.description: As daylight approaches, public transport starts to become available again and the trio starts making their way back home. Here, we see Vinz alone and looking frustrated as he stares out the window whilst Hubert and Saïd sit patiently on the right.

chapter4.title: 30. Arguments
chapter4.description: Saïd, in an attempt at talking sense into him, tries to convince Vinz against using or keeping the pistol and tries telling him that it will eventually lead to his death.

chapter4.title: 31. Skinhead
chapter4.description: While the gang is walking, a skinhead from earlier recognizes them and Vinz, who had pushed a pistol against his (the skinhead's) temple earlier. He does the same to Vinz and begins to laugh maniacally at the power he has gained. In his excitement, he accidentally lets go of the trigger and kills Vinz, shooting a bullet into his brain.

chapter4.title: 32. Hatred
chapter4.description: Vinz lies dead, against the car. Hubert, in his anger, picks up his gun and points it toward the skinhead. The man who had been advocating against using the gun all along was the one who had to make use of it eventually

chapter4.title: 33. Get Set
chapter4.description: Saïd stares at the scene in disbelief. Too much has happened in the past few minutes as he looks at Hubert and the skinhead aiming at each other. The words begin to echo - Ever heard of the man who fell off the skyscraper?

chapter4.title: 34. Bang
chapter4.description: We hear a loud gunshot, however we don't know who shoots the gun. Saïd closes his eyes, and the movie ends.
